title: ag.algebraic geometry - Spaces intersecting a plane non-trivially in $G(3,6)$
body: I want to understand the Schubert variety $\Sigma\subseteq G(3,6)$ representing 3-dim subspaces intersecting a given 2-dim subspace non-trivially. Is it smooth? How to describe $det(T_{\Sigma})$ ? ag.algebraic-geometry schubert-varieties Share Cite Improve this question Follow asked Jul 15, 2020 at 14:02 Nanjun Yang 1,024 5 5 silver badges 12 12 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 1 3 $\begingroup$ if you denote by $A$ the given two dimensional subspace, then the locus you are looking for is the degenracy locus of $\mathcal{R} \longrightarrow \mathbb{C}^6/A \otimes \mathcal{O}_{G(3,6)}$, where $\mathcal{R}$ is the tautological bundle on $G(3,6)$. It should be of codimension 2 in $G(3,6)$. is not smooth and its singular locus is the strata $\{L \in G(3,6), \ L \supset A \}$. There is a huge litterature on degeneracy loci $\endgroup$ Libli –  Libli 2020-07-15 14:29:25 +00:00 Commented Jul 15, 2020 at 14:29 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
